data.text: @willhowells It was good, but not his best. Despite some of Sorkin’s very best efforts, I found the attempts to illicit certain feelings about Molly to be unconvincing (largely due to how predictably it unfolded both here and in real life) but it barrels along well. Stream it, but don’t buy.
@Chris_Ince I am interested to know how this is.
@Chris_Ince Still need to watch Jobs as well.

@martin_costello It’s certainly worth it for the performances and, as a general rule, I always make sure not to miss something he’s written (even if he is starting to lean a bit too heavy and tries to beatify his subjects). It’s not bad for his directorial debut either.
@adebradley @Chris_Ince Sweeeet. That’s film for watching once we are done with Kath and Kim.
@adebradley @Chris_Ince We caught out by “Free? Lol” a lot.
@adebradley @Chris_Ince Included, or “hey, pay extra and we’ll also let you watch this”?
@Chris_Ince I need to remember to watch this when it reaches streaming as I didn’t see it at the cinema.
